website_summaries.verdict: We expect more from a $99 slow cooker, and so should you.There are smarter upgrades than this, and they don't cost quite as much.
pros: The Frigidaire Professional 7-Quart Programmable Slow Cooker looks the part of a high-end appliance and offers four distinct slow-cooking presets
cons: That great-looking design isn't terribly practical, with a complete lack of helpful features and no discernible performance advantage over cheaper competitors

customer_reviews.title: I think it's left like that to meet Food/Health regulations though
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this for months now and it's been making my life a lot easier with meal prepping. I just wish the default times for Low/Medium/High were lower, as a lot of times I find the meals to be done 1-2 hours earlier. I think it's left like that to meet Food/Health regulations though, so probably won't see at change. The option for lower times is still there, you just have to keep adding time until it cycles around. I just wished there was an adjustable vent on the top. Some meals I make end up having way too much water left over.
customer_reviews.author: William Luo

customer_reviews.title: What a crock of junk ...
customer_reviews.text: This is junk. Used it one time and the ceramic bowl cracked while in use. Good thing I was home when it happened. About half way through cooking on low I heard a loud "pop" and went to the kitchen to find that the bowl cracked in half down the middle and everything was leaking into pot that started smoking. I would NOT purchase thus product. Wasted a meal and returned to Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Luv Amazon2

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy lid handle
customer_reviews.text: Visually, it's exactly what I was hoping for but that's not as important as its function. I purchased this crock pot to replace one that worked faithfully for 8 years ... I was hoping for the same durability with this purchase but the handle to the lid broke upon first use!!! Just as I was ready to enjoy my first meal cooked in this Frigidaire Professional crock pot, I lifted the lid, and was very close to burning myself as one end of the handle completely came apart. Now It's too late to return the product. Very disappointed!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: After 4 attempts in making this work, I finally ...
customer_reviews.text: After 4 attempts in making this work, I finally decided to put in a return request with Amazon. I use slow cookers a lot. Unlike the Crock Pot brand slow cookers I've used in the past (4 quart and 6 quart models), this never seems to cook evenly or consistently. I decided to watch a soup progress rather than leave it unattended -- and was concerned when I noticed the soup never reached a boil. Very disappointing. I'll be sending this back and buying the similarly priced Crock Pot brand 7 quart option instead. It doesn't have a timer, but there are various wall outlet timers available you can use in its place.
customer_reviews.author: EvanGMan

customer_reviews.title: What a crock!!!.....
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I was looking for in a crock pot...I was looking for a different brand and style, but when I saw this one, I figured I would give it a try. I've only used it a few times since my purchase, but it works fine, cooks great, and has the cooking options I wanted (and then some). If you're looking for a nice size crock pot that does just about everything, look no further. This is well worth the money and has a classy look (as far as crock pots go).
customer_reviews.author: Rob S.

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with my purchase. I love that it will automatically switch to warm after the cooking time has elapsed - no need to worry about overcooking if you don't make it home in time. And, unlike a few other reviewers, I have no complaints about the lid not fitting properly. I really appreciate the larger 7 quart size to accommodate big batches of sauce, soups, stews, turkey breast, etc. I choose this product based on the various positive reviews that I read, the fact that it had a variety of settings, the oblong removable crock, the Frigidaire name, and the price. I don't think you will be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: LovindaUP

customer_reviews.title: Unless you like glass in your food....
customer_reviews.text: I bought this a while back, used it a total of three times. I used it just the other day and the glass lid shattered. For no reason. There was no cold air, liquid, or anything touching it. The setting was on warm to keep what I made hot. Not made like they were. I suggest looking elsewhere for a slow cooker!
customer_reviews.author: Tara

customer_reviews.title: Great Slow Cooker
customer_reviews.text: I could not be happier with this slow cooker. The size is perfect for making large or multiple meals at once, a whole chicken or roast, and even desserts. I love that it has a programmable timer so I can set it and leave it and once it is done it will beep and automatically switch to warm for up to 4 hours before turning off. I have made plenty of meals in it so far and all have been very good.
customer_reviews.author: Carmen

customer_reviews.title: Nice Crock pot!
customer_reviews.text: I have used it 4 times now & I love it!! My old one you could only program on low for 8hrs or 10hrs & on high for 4hrs or 6hrs. After the time was up, it would go to warm. This one you can program to low, med, high or warm & set your cook time. I looked at a LOT of different crock pots, a lot of them are only 4-6 quarts, but wanted one a little bigger. Like to make big batches of soup & it does hold a LOT! A big plus is, it washes up great!
customer_reviews.author: junegirl74

customer_reviews.title: Super happy with this!
customer_reviews.text: I think I read every review of every slow cooker before committing to this one, but I am really glad I decided to go ahead and buy this even though I thought it seemed overly expensive. Everything fits in here, and best of all it works the way it is supposed to. My last slow cooker was a large Crock Pot, and it ran too hot. After just a year it burned out. I hope this one lasts for a long time because I really have zero complaints about its function.
customer_reviews.author: Mary F.

customer_reviews.title: Love this slow cooker.
customer_reviews.text: OK. It is like a ship on my counter, but I make bone broth once a week and this slow cooker rocks. I don't know how anyone can complain about it. It would be great for people who feed a family or entertain. We no longer have children at home and almost never entertain, but back when, I would have loved this slow cooker and had it going for more than just bone broth.
customer_reviews.author: J. Clark

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: We had to throw this away after a month or so. It started overheating, The one star is generous because a negative star is not an option
customer_reviews.author: Shannon

customer_reviews.title: Grat, but not 7Qt
customer_reviews.text: This unit is nice, sturdy, and has the features I want. I don't know how they get away with calling it 7Qt though. Even 6 qts is way too much to put in this crock. Other brands seem to be doing the same stupid marketing and are no bigger. My older Kitchen Aid 7Qt unit could actually be used with 7qts of liquid in it. I think others would market it as 8 or 9 quarts today :(
customer_reviews.author: Tatyana R.

customer_reviews.title: SO DISAPPOINTED... first review ever
customer_reviews.text: SO Disappointed!! Just received this slow cooker today and used it for the first time to make ham and beans. Started cooking at 1:30 on low ..looking forward to a delicious meal. Returned home at 7:30pm to find the soup wasn't even simmering! Wondering if lid doesn't fit right. I don't know; just DO KNOW that I'm not happy. Was looking forward to serving a delicious meal to my family and that did not happen. I've turned this up to high and hopefully this will be ready for tomorrow's dinner. We'll see.
customer_reviews.author: Janet K. White

customer_reviews.title: Our model is not cooking very hot
customer_reviews.text: Even after on high for 6 hours, some soups are not done. The temp of a full pot of soup after 6 hours or so was only ~180F. I would expect high to nearly boil and taper down from there. As it stands now, we pretty much would have to pre-heat soups to use it. I need to follow up with customer service to see if I can get it fixed. I've heard some people received crocks that were too small...
customer_reviews.author: Joel J. Schmelzle

customer_reviews.title: Great Slow Cooker
customer_reviews.text: We received this and the lid didn't fit, called customer service and they shipped out another lid and that didn't fit either. We called customer service again and this time the representative we spoke to said that it sounded like it was a problem with the insert and not the lid. He shipped a new insert to us and it worked perfectly. We have only used the cooker one time but it did a superb job.
customer_reviews.author: Dean

customer_reviews.title: Wish I could program two cooking times simultaneously...
customer_reviews.text: Because, for example, if I need to start a dish on High for an hour and then finish on Low for 7-8 hours, I have to do something else for that hour before I reprogram from High-Low, and only then am I free to leave home, as it's only able to hold one program (one specific heat for a set period) at a time. It's either plan another single temp. recipe or make sure I'm in no hurry the mornings I use this. The good things: it cooks really well (no hot spots); has long programming times; and automatically clicks to a "keep warm" setting after the cooking time is complete.
customer_reviews.author: knitmom

customer_reviews.title: Good Slow Cooker
customer_reviews.text: Temperature is hotter than my previous slow cooker on the "buffet" setting....actually remains hot enough to still be cooking on "low". The insert is lighter than I expected (nice surprise) - overall a good slow cooker.
customer_reviews.author: AppleCody

customer_reviews.title: 4 Star Slow Cooker
customer_reviews.text: This Crockpot has been great, but the lid does not seem to fit as tightly as I would have hoped & the feet on the bottom of the pot ... 2 of them has broken off. I need to call the company for replacements. But, the crockpot cooks amazing.. I love that I have many options for programming, too
customer_reviews.author: FABS

customer_reviews.title: Cooks great
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking for a new slow cooker for awhile. Finally pulled the trigger and got one. I love the Frigidaire Professional model. I can't believe it has taken me this long to get a digital slow cooker. I have been using a crock pot with a Low and Hi setting. I love the fact that after your meal has gone through the cooking time that you have set it to, it automatically goes into a "warm" mode that keeps your food warm.
customer_reviews.author: DW

customer_reviews.title: Nicely Built!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my wife...(but I do all the cooking!...) The build quality is by far superior to Crock-Pot. Nice solid stainless steel handles with thick aluminum rivets... high quality digital control panel... thick solid ceramic pot that's easy to clean.... controls are accurate... VERY ACCURATE... cooks perfecto!
customer_reviews.author: Cappy

customer_reviews.title: Very nice slow cooker
customer_reviews.text: This is a very professional looking cooker after some I have had. Not sure it is quite as big as marketed but it does hold a lot. I like it so well I might buy another one as we use crockpots a lot. I made a pot of chili in it and it was done in a hurry. I like the controls too. I don't think anyone would be disappointed with this unit.
customer_reviews.author: Ohio Reid

customer_reviews.title: Love the 7 capacity
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. Love the 7 capacity. One word of caution, the lid and crock handles are metal. They will be hot to the touch when you try to move the entire crock pot or lift a lid.
customer_reviews.author: DJ

customer_reviews.title: Must have for family meals...kids can set up meals!
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful stainless server-ready equipment and perfect functioning. Has 5 settings as opposed to most others with only 2 speeds. Has Low, Medium, High, Soup, and Buffet settings where others have only a Slow and High. Will also stop when time runs out and put itself into Warm mode. Can make huge roasts/casseroles/soups, bunch of vegetables, and plenty of sauce with nothing but the prepping of your vegetables. Your kids can learn to set this up with the touch LED display and make a whole meal without you. Buy a slow-cooker cookbook and try everything in it. Inside surface is smooth for simple cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: SuperFan

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what you want in a crockpot
customer_reviews.text: Got this as a birthday gift for my wife who loves to cook. Our last crockpot did the job but was small, hard to clean, and not programmable. This unit lets her cook a lot more food a lot easier. She can set it up before she goes to work and not have to worry about it having to run home to change the settings.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Margolis

customer_reviews.title: great crock pot
customer_reviews.text: We're very happy with this crock pot. The low is still higher than I would prefer, but it appears to be one of the lowest temp crock pots around.
customer_reviews.author: EasyT

customer_reviews.title: This is really nice, however I was hoping that I could put ...
customer_reviews.text: This is really nice, however I was hoping that I could put a frozen roast in it and it would come on in 4 hours, but the timer only works for shutting it off. Still a nice size for a big family
customer_reviews.author: Workin Woman

customer_reviews.title: I had no issues with this slow cooker and loved it until yesterday when I last used it
customer_reviews.text: I had no issues with this slow cooker and loved it until yesterday when I last used it. Put crock in sink to soak, and wiped down the outside sat it on the counter and the front control panel fell out. Called the company and there first question to me was can you tell me how you got this number? I find that very odd. They refused to do anything and basically told me that an $80 small appliance is not guaranteed to last more than 1 year. DON'T BY FRIGIDAIRE!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey S. Groby

customer_reviews.title: Great product! Would highly recommend it to anyone!
customer_reviews.text: Love this slow cooker! It cooks evenly, has a crisp, clear design, it's easy to use, and it has a large capacity. I also love all the cooking options. This was a big upgrade from my crockpot slow cooker which totally and randomly stopped working after only 4 years of use.
customer_reviews.author: OutdoorThorman

customer_reviews.title: So disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this item a month ago. Used it 3 times maybe 4 and the ceramic insert is shattering/cracking. Pics included. One is the inside of the exterior and the damage caused by the leaking liquid. The other is the outside of the insert showing the hundreds of hairline cracks. I also am now past the return time so I spent my money on garbage!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works very well.
customer_reviews.text: Great slow cooker love the stainless steel and the digital read out. Does a great job cooking. I have had no problems with is what so ever. Timing and heat levels work well with the recipes I use.
customer_reviews.author: mudslides

customer_reviews.title: Six temperatures - 135 - 160 - 185 - 195 - 205 - 215 - amazing cooker - fast shipping
customer_reviews.text: Six temperature settings! This is an amazing slow cooker with six temperatures that are: warm 135 - buffet 160 - soup 185 - low 195 - med 205 - high 215. I have checked all the temperatures with a device. Fast shipping with Amazon, best customer service ever!
customer_reviews.author: Sunshine

customer_reviews.title: Very happy so far!
customer_reviews.text: I've only used this twice so far but it worked beautifully. My lamb shanks were awesome. The directions could have been clearer on how to use the timers. When you hit "low", the default time is 8 hrs. I didn't realize that if you scroll through the cook times, you can get back to lower numbers and cook on low for less time and then it will go to warm. Knowing this would have helped my BBQ chicken breasts. They were good but a bit overlooked. Now I'm hopeful that this will work exactly as I had hoped.
customer_reviews.author: laurarice26

customer_reviews.title: Great slow cooker
customer_reviews.text: So far I love it. It has great temp control and a digital readout. Automatically switches to warm when the timer is up. Has no hot spots that I've noticed and cooks at an even temp, unlike my previous slow cooker.
customer_reviews.author: S. Capps

customer_reviews.title: Solid product
customer_reviews.text: Good quality product, hearts well..the many buttons/options almost make it seem to complex; still pleased though
customer_reviews.author: Theo H.

customer_reviews.title: always in use!
customer_reviews.text: Huge slow cooker but the foot print is the same as a smaller one. I got it to be able to make soup stock with a cooker full of bones and water, and later to be able to make enough soup to freeze and share... very easy to use and to clean!
customer_reviews.author: TexasPepper

customer_reviews.title: Easiest Way To Cook Ever!
customer_reviews.text: Looks sharp, 5 to 10 minutes for prep and ready to cook, great combination dishes, hundreds of recipes available, and doubles as party buffet warmer. Highly recommend for large cooking jobs or enough stew for every meal for very day for a week!
customer_reviews.author: Prof. Docwell

customer_reviews.title: Not real happy with this product
customer_reviews.text: Not real happy with this product. I know it's a slow cooker but it takes at least 6 hours for it to get to a small rolling boil. It also turned off during the night even though the timer was still going.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah A. James

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: One of the rubber feet fell off this after some use, and Frigidaire charged me $6.70 for a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Allan Wind

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: We're a family of 5, and the size and convenience of this product suits us perfectly. It's programmable (a rarity!) and the volume is just the right amount for us. I like to make 2 meals per pot, and this 7-quart pot is just right. Plus, the pot itself is really nice -- a solid and pretty painted ceramic. Nice for presentation.
customer_reviews.author: Sara Ray

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: My only complaint was you can't set timer to cook in high then low
customer_reviews.author: NSC

customer_reviews.title: This is a great slow cooker!!
customer_reviews.text: I love it because I can put it on for the amount of hours and then it puts it on warm all by itself. It is big enough for our family of 7. I would recommend this for it's looks and quality. The outer shell probably will not look as nice years to come due to denting is easy but I like the stainless look and wouldn't change that. Great price for all the others I looked at before. We have used it every day since getting it. Kinda a slow cooker coma over here.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Morphis

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: It's nice having the extra room! Had for several months now and with regular use, it cooks just fine!
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: 7 qt Slow Cooker
customer_reviews.text: I love this one. I had one that was smaller but wanted to upgrade to a larger size and found this one. I wanted a programmable one like my old one and was very impressed with all the different options on this one. I only have one issue with it and its that the outside gets VERY HOT so I have to push it to the back of my counter so my kids don't accidentally reach up, touch it and burn themselves.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is much better and looks great on the
customer_reviews.text: Switched from Crockpot brand. This is much better and looks great on the counter
customer_reviews.author: Paul Goins

customer_reviews.title: It apparently does not have a good heating element
customer_reviews.text: I have used this slow cooker twice since purchasing and both times have had to cook 2 plus more hours for each recipe. It apparently does not have a good heating element. I would not recommend this product to anyone..........
customer_reviews.author: Pauline M. D'Aurora

customer_reviews.title: Very well built and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: We use this often, so we have dinner ready when we're done with our after school activities. Really easy to program and clean. We love the sturdy construction, all metal handles that don't get hot.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Kraft

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful crockpot.
customer_reviews.text: I really love this, especially the timer. It cooks food perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: KAT

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Used it and love it. Was easy to clean and program. Some other brands have a thermometer to check if the meat is cooked. That is the only thing that was missing
customer_reviews.author: Tom Wieser

customer_reviews.title: Crock Pot
customer_reviews.text: Love it!!!!! It is so large and love the optional settings and timer. Can't find any negative things to report!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great crock pot. Let's you select whatever temp you want.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great crockpot
customer_reviews.text: Wife loves it and has started cooking more. I would suggest anyone buy this. Works just like it should and easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Great crock pot!
customer_reviews.text: I love the look and the way it performs. It was packaged very well and arrived on time. I love that it has many cooking speeds and options.
customer_reviews.author: Misty

customer_reviews.title: Great slow cooker
customer_reviews.text: This is the first slow cooker that we have owned. Have had it for about 2 months and made three meals in it, 2 beef shanks and 1 beef round. All have come out beautifully. I was concerned about the size, it's just the two of us, but I find that I can easily fill it up and the meals last for a couple of days. The lid does not fit tight, but we decided to try it anyways. Does not seem to be a problem with those three meals. Other than that, I have been very impressed and look forward to trying out other meals.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine Fahey

customer_reviews.title: Worked Wonderfully
customer_reviews.text: We had guests for the holidays and got to use it. It was great. It was big enough to make a good amount of curry stew for eight people.
customer_reviews.author: J. T. Baker

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased w/ product. No complaints what-so-ever. Would recommend this unit to anyone looking for a new slow cooker of very usable size.
customer_reviews.author: H. E. Noble

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: We like the replacement for our failed crockpot a lot.
customer_reviews.author: RCIdaho

customer_reviews.title: Gift
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for my daughter-in-law. She says it's a great cooker. Big with plenty of room for large meals. Loves the programmable option.
customer_reviews.author: CJohns

customer_reviews.title: Product review!
customer_reviews.text: Great product! Love the extra large size! Makes cooking large meals so easy!
customer_reviews.author: Cookie

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied customer
customer_reviews.text: I liked the little larger capacity.. There are more setting options including the warm setting that keeps food warm after its finished cooking. The stainless steel looks great with my other stainless appliances.
customer_reviews.author: Lee Kirby

customer_reviews.title: THis is such a well made product
customer_reviews.text: I cook almost everything in a slow cooker and this is top-of-the-line for any price. Also, the seven quart capacity is huge and plenty big enough for our family of six.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Plunkett

customer_reviews.title: Frigidaire Professional 7-Quart Programmable Slow Cooker replaced an original Crock Pot.
customer_reviews.text: This slow cooker is larger and easy to program. I can set and forget. Able to prepare a large meal and not worry about overflow.
customer_reviews.author: allen scott

customer_reviews.title: Only works for 4 hours.
customer_reviews.text: We didn't open the package for almost a month because we were just too busy. When we opened it, it only worked for the 4-hour setting, which isn't at all what we need since we both work full time. Unfortunately, because we were one day past the day to return it (I didn't realize there was a time limit), we couldn't even return it. So basically, we sunk $75 into a piece of junk that is taking up space in our garage.
customer_reviews.author: JulieG

customer_reviews.title: Great Crock Pot
customer_reviews.text: I received this as a present. I wanted a bigger crock pot, this was the biggest we could find. Easy to use and clean, great buy!!
customer_reviews.author: Dawn Bonney

customer_reviews.title: love this slow cooker
customer_reviews.text: bought this slow cooker to replace my other one that was broken. I have used it multiple times, & I love it! straight sides make it easy to clean. I love that it goes to warm automatically when the cooking is done- this has saved my meals several times. so glad i bought it! :)
customer_reviews.author: mommajulie

customer_reviews.title: Worked Great, Then Cracked but was replaced.
customer_reviews.text: My wife really liked this and we used it alot, then just 6 months after we purchased it, it began to leak all over. We found a hairline crack that ran clear under the pot rendering it useless. EDIT: I contacted customer support and they are sending me out a new one. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Skurj

customer_reviews.title: Nice for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Great for a large capacity, inexpensive slow cooker. It has enough functions to be really handy! Easy to use, too.
customer_reviews.author: Ann Pinsky

customer_reviews.title: It was a nice piece of equipment
customer_reviews.text: It was a nice piece of equipment, but the on/off switch didn't work. The way they handles my refund was excellent though. Would try another piece at any time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: NIce Product
customer_reviews.text: Looks good heats well, just wish it had a better seal for a better cooking experience.. overall though its nice
customer_reviews.author: Bens Owner

customer_reviews.title: She loved the size
customer_reviews.text: Christmas gift for my daughter who loves the size of this.
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: This crock pot is worth the money
customer_reviews.text: This crock pot is amazing always cooks tender the modes of heat are so convenient. Soup mode is great I make a lot of soups.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew S.

customer_reviews.title: NEW: Body very cheap, separating from heating element.
customer_reviews.text: Love the metal handles on both slow cooker and lid however, the stainless steel body is very cheap. Just received and body seems to be separating from heating element. Will return for other slow cooker.
customer_reviews.author: Rex B.

customer_reviews.title: Just right.
customer_reviews.text: This gift was a request from my daughter-in-law. When we spoke she was very pleased with it. With two teenage boys, she is very busy and the programmable feature is ideal.
customer_reviews.author: Trish

customer_reviews.title: Slow cooker
customer_reviews.text: This is just what we were looking for. Most of the ones in the stores did not have a medium cooking level and this one is a great size and has every feature that we were looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Ingle

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful item, easy to use, easy to clean and cooks perfectly. I am extremely pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Clara Landeros

customer_reviews.title: It has a good control front
customer_reviews.text: As I have read, the lid that came with this product does not fit. I too am calling the Frigidaire number to see if I can get another lid. It has a good control front, easy to program and cooks well, no hot spots.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Brown

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to see and use controls. Nice size for about anything you might want to make. Bright display! Easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: willie301

customer_reviews.title: Everything I Wanted!
customer_reviews.text: We searched long and hard for the right crockpot, we've gone through several, and this is it. It's big and sturdy. Cooks everything perfectly, easy to clean and work. It's been wonderful!
customer_reviews.author: D. Draper

customer_reviews.title: WONDERFUL PRODUCT!
customer_reviews.text: POSITIVE: A definite yes for anyone who loves to use a crock pot!! Lots of room, settings are varied enough for different types of food. NEGATIVES: Handles do get very hot when used and no instructions for using the different settings. That would have been nice.
customer_reviews.author: rnarmy1

customer_reviews.title: This looks to be great quality. She loves it already just after one ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my mother as a replacement for a celerbrity name brand slow cooker. This looks to be great quality. She loves it already just after one use.
customer_reviews.author: cjbaker

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Love the capacity and the custom time settings! It is nice to be able to add time to the cooking when needed.
customer_reviews.author: S. Mikow

customer_reviews.title: Just excellent!
customer_reviews.text: I recently received this crock pot and used it right away. I made a delicious brisket in it and a vegetarian chili right after that. I LOVE IT! It's big, heavy, well made and the food comes out juicy and moist. I would recommend this item to anyone who wants to have a serious crock pot. LOVE IT!!!
customer_reviews.author: Oscarthe wonderdog

customer_reviews.title: And The Winner Is? Frigidaire.
customer_reviews.text: I am most please with my Frigidaire Professional Stainless 7 QT. Slow Cooker. I would not hesitate to buy another product by Frigidaire. Thank You. RJ.
customer_reviews.author: Robert  Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Looks Great ~ Works Great
customer_reviews.text: As a retired homemaker, I've gone through many crock pots and/or slow cookers. The Frigidaire 7 quart slow cooker I just purchased from Amazon is by far the best one ever! And the Frigidaire name has been around for a long time. I'm only giving 4 stars because you have to turn it off to change the settings and the timer and then turn it back on. I read the booklet and that is the way I understood the instructions. If I'm wrong I hope someone corrects me! Other than that, I love it and it's so "pretty" sitting on the counter doing the cooking for me!!!
customer_reviews.author: Pampered Retiree

customer_reviews.title: Great crock pot!
customer_reviews.text: Love this crock pot Big and looks fantastic on the counter. Makes a perfect meal every time. Cleanup easy.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie Mount

customer_reviews.title: ... cooker is everything it was promised to be very satisfied!
customer_reviews.text: This cooker is everything it was promised to be very satisfied!
customer_reviews.author: Dara Fooshee

customer_reviews.title: I really like the extra size capacity for potlucks
customer_reviews.text: I really like the extra size capacity for potlucks. However, it could only be improved if it had a locking top for transport.☺️
customer_reviews.author: Florence Fullerton

customer_reviews.title: Great slow cooker
customer_reviews.text: So far I like everything about this slow cooker except the fact that the max timer setting is 12 hours. I like to put my roast in on Saturday afternoon and let it cook until lunch Sunday so that it is fall-apart tender and I have to try to remember to go back and reset it or it will go to keep warm. However, the programming feature is nice for pork loin or chops for Sunday lunch.
customer_reviews.author: J. Blackwood

customer_reviews.title: Love this cooker
customer_reviews.text: I have used this slow cooker twice so far and I love it. The only thing I don't like is that the handle on the lid gets very hot. They could have figured out a different material to make the handle more user friendly. Otherwise, it is a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Toni Hudson

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works great, I bought two of them and we love the size.
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Great large pot.
customer_reviews.text: It took me a while to figure out how to use this pot but once I did I really like it. It is large enough to hold a whole chicken and a large roast. I have purchased a smaller one to handle stew beef. This one was just to large for that. It works great. I am very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: B. Brown

customer_reviews.title: 7 Quarts of Heaven!
customer_reviews.text: Thank God for a crock pot for a big family! I have 4 kids and need all the space I can get. Yes 1 or 1 and1/2 quarts makes a difference. Plus it is a great model! Very pleased I did not have to settle for a not-so-nice one just for the size. Highly Recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Beth K

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Looks great and cooks even better. Love digital display with timer. Quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Maria D.

customer_reviews.title: Liked it.
customer_reviews.text: Yes my daughter-in-law liked it and had already researched it when she put it on her Christmas List. Started to order one for myself after she told me about it.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret Williams

customer_reviews.title: Daugther is the Chef
customer_reviews.text: Daughter uses it about three days a week. Has four temp settings which to her is a plus. Pot is quite heavy, as are they all. Wish somebody would market one with the pluses of this, but a lighter ceramic pot.
customer_reviews.author: Cousin' Bruce

customer_reviews.title: Great item!
customer_reviews.text: This slow cooker is excellent in size, looks as well as performance! Highly recommend this item to everyone! Delivery was quick and arrived in perfect condition!
customer_reviews.author: Vicky Connell

customer_reviews.title: Pro's & Con
customer_reviews.text: Fast shipping and protected well. We love the machine and use it all the time. Cooks great & love the timer, ease of use, size, and light weight of the outer "shell". Only has 1 downfall that stopped us from giving 5 stars. The lid handle. One side popped off the fitting and is loose. Now comes the issue of do I fix it, do I just use it, or do I try to get a replacement....
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: It's ok but not satisfy me.
customer_reviews.text: It does not give the same results as the one my brother has. I used and the food was still not done after 8 hours.
customer_reviews.author: Gloria R. Sheppard

customer_reviews.title: Not good.
customer_reviews.text: Loose fitting cover, metal handle that would get hot. Returned. Not good.
customer_reviews.author: Peg

customer_reviews.title: dissappointed
customer_reviews.text: Specified as 7 qt. It barely holds 6. Very dissappointed! I chose this one due to it's larger capacity. :-(
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Frigidaire Professional Stainless 7-Quart Programmable Slow Cooker
product_meta.description:
An attractive appliance built for performance and durability, the Frigidaire Professional™ 7 Quart Slow Cooker will get great results in the kitchen and streamline your cooking routine.

The easy-to-use Pro-Select™ display and six preset Pro-Select™ One-Touch Options on the Slow Cooker demonstrate the Frigidaire Professional™ commitment to high performance and high function, making it an asset for any at-home chef seeking a reliable kitchen solution.

 PRODUCT FEATURES
Spacewise™ Design 
The clever seven-quart capacity design makes the most of counter space with a unique shape that provides a large cooking area, and a style that looks great in the kitchen. From big meals to small servings, the Frigidaire Professional™ Slow Cooker provides maximum cooking flexibility.

Pro-Select™ LED Display 
An easy-to-use timer and six preset Pro-Select™ One-Touch Options on the display eliminate guesswork with any slow cooker recipe. The bright Pro-Select™ LED Display is large and easy to see in dark or bright lighting. 

Pro-Select™ One-Touch Options 
Like having your favorite meals on speed dial! Frigidaire Professional™ built in six preset Pro-Select™ One-Touch Options to make slow cooking even simpler. Choose from buffet, soup, low, medium, high or warm with one quick touch. 

Fully Programmable 
Completely customizable to your cooking needs, just select the cooking option, program the time, then choose the Auto Keep-Warm control to hold the temperature up to three hours until you’re ready to serve the meal. 

ADDITIONAL FEATURES 
For convenient cooking and to help achieve great results, the Frigidaire Professional™ Slow Cooker offers several special features including:

• Stylish Stainless-Steel Exterior contributes to a durable and great-looking design

• Easy-View Glass Lid shows you the progress of what’s cooking 

• Ergonomic-Designed Die Cast Handles help easily transport the cooker around the kitchen or on-the-go

Frigidaire Professional™ kitchen appliances are known for their attractive design and powerful, easy-to-use features. Now that same level of high performance, durability and style is available in the new small appliance collection. The Frigidaire Professional™ Slow Cooker offers an easy-to-read Pro-Select™ LED Display and six preset Pro-Select™ One-Touch Options that ensure quality results, making it an asset for any at-home chef seeking a reliable kitchen solution. Its attractive stainless steel design, simple controls and powerful features offer high performance and function that help you achieve great results. Add the Frigidaire Professional family to your kitchen Large 7-quart capacity and fully programmable cooking options keeps the food nice and warm Unique shape that provides a large cooking area and a style that looks great in the kitchen Big meals to small servings, this slow cooker provides maximum cooking flexibility Pro-select one-touch options on the display eliminate guesswork with any slow cooker recipe Easy to lift handles allow transporting this cooker around the kitchen extremely convenient

CUSTOMER REVIEWS
4.2 out of 5 stars4.2 out of 5307 customer ratings 5 star 68% 4 star 9% 3 star 9% 2 star 4% 1 star 10% How are ratings calculated?To calculate the overall star rating and percentage breakdown by star, we don’t use a simple average. Instead, our system considers things like how recent a review is and if the reviewer bought the item on Amazon. It also analyzes reviews to verify trustworthiness. 





CUSTOMER IMAGES
See all customer images Top reviews Most recent Top reviews THERE WAS A PROBLEM FILTERING REVIEWS RIGHT NOW. PLEASE TRY AGAIN LATER.
Y. Callewaert5.0 out of 5 stars Frigidaire Slow CookerReviewed in the United States on January 10, 2014Verified Purchase I researched many slow cookers, reading reviews, asking other owners about what they like about theirs. Price was not a major concern in my case, so I looked at far more expensive ones than this one.
I considered the one which you could use right on the cooktop for searing meat. However, was not pleased with the idea of a non stick layer, which apparently had peeling issues as well.

I checked out many of them in stores. Another concern I had was the glass lid, and the screw to hold the handle in place. I read many reviews where the screw started rusting and dripping rust into the meal.

When I purchased this one, now 2 years ago, I wasn't sure what to expect as there weren't many reviews at the time.

I was extremely pleased when it arrived, the lid fit well on the insert, the insert looked beautiful, ceramic and the options for settings were more than sufficient for my needs.

I have used this one off and on for the past 2 years. I love the large capacity, but have also cooked smaller meals in it without a problem (as long as you have enough liquid). I use it mainly for beef stew and beans.

Having said that, I do get the same results with my old cast iron pot and low temperature oven, but I still like my slow cooker as well.

I would buy this one again. After 2 years, it still looks very good although I do not wash it in the dishwasher. I hand wash and dry both lid and insert (and it only takes a minute or less)

Highly recommended!

Jan 2016: I have had this one for 4 years now and use it weekly, mostly in winter. Still love it and still works fantastic. No regrets.Read more 12 people found this helpful Helpful Comment Report abuse JG5.0 out of 5 stars Had a little problem but a nice unit. Just got it made in 2010 !! READReviewed in the United States on December 10, 2015Verified Purchase I just received this unit and there was a problem, the glass lid wobbles not giving the top a good seal, instead of returning it I called Fridgedare customer service they were extremely nice and helpful they will be shipping me a new lid for this cooker. I tested the heating and electronics and they function fine. A very good looking slow cooker which I am sure will perform well with the new lid this is why I gave it 4 stars. I would to add that when I gave the serial number to customer service they were a bit surprised this unit that Amazon sent me was made in 2010, I was a bit surprised and so were they ! I didn't know that Amazon keep items for sale on the shelf so long !!
UPDATE:
Warranty sent a new lid and included a new ceramic crock insert my request was made on 11 of Dec. and I received it on the 16th of Dec. very fast service, all fits perfect now. I just cooked a large roast in it today and it turned tender and perfect ! I decided to change my rating to 5 stars this unit is well worth the money!Read more 3 people found this helpful Helpful Comment Report abuse Joshua5.0 out of 5 stars ... for about 18 months now and it has been great. I spent hours (daysReviewed in the United States on July 6, 2015Verified Purchase Have had this for about 18 months now and it has been great. I spent hours (days?) researching slow cookers and comparing them on Amazon. One thing you'll notice is that a majority seem to have only a single-screw handle on the lid. I was adamant to avoid a single-screw handle again as that was one of the main failure points of my last slow cooker. As you can tell, this has a nice metal handle with 2 screws through the lid to help distribute the load.

This thing cooks nicely, is well built, and even looks nice. There are plenty of temperature, hold, delay options and it can hold a lot of food or liquid. The pan itself has been through my dishwasher a number of times and always comes out clean with no issues.

The only drawback to this unit is actually the brushed stainless steel exterior. Any drippings or food that gets on it seems to stick a little more to the metal than it does some of the plastic exteriors. Not too big of a deal as it will eventually come clean, but the only drawback that I can think of.Read more 2 people found this helpful Helpful Comment Report abuse Kannada4.0 out of 5 stars Great with caveatsReviewed in the United States on October 25, 2013Verified Purchase I've only used it once so far, but here's my experience.

The Pros:

1) The temperature control seems ideal. It took roughly two hours, two and half hours, for the high setting to reach it's maximum temperature. At that stage, my food was simmering but not boiling. Per Cook's Illustrated review of slow cookers (this model wasn't among their test subjects), best results come from high temperatures around the 200 degree mark, which this appears to do. At the end of the day, temperature control is probably the most important feature of any slow cooker.

2) Design pluses: Programming is easy, plenty of settings, interior dimensions are good, looks good on the counter.

Now the cons:

1) The lid is not great. It doesn't fit snugly, which I guess is fairly common? The lid has a slight dome and this allowed a bit of steam to run off into onto the lip of the insert, which then dripped down over the front of the cooker. Worse yet, when I served some of the food out of the insert and left the remaining food cooking on warm, the air pressure built up and we heard some rattles as the lid popped up and down. More liquid dripped down onto the lip, or just plain escaped so that I turned the cooker off for fear of drying out the food. (It was still at simmering temperature about a half hour or so after it went to warm.) I don't understand why these lids aren't designed with a small hole to release air pressure without releasing liquid.

2) Other design flaws: The insert handles are too short, which means they get too warm. The lid handle also gets too hot -- there really should be a bit of silicon under the handle. The exterior of the cooker gets pretty darn warm. I have NO idea why this is endemic to slow cookers -- wouldn't it be more efficient to insulate them?

I debated long and hard between this and the Crockpot touchscreen. I'm still debating whether to return this and try the other... I particularly like the 20 hour feature on the other, but 12 hours certainly isn't a deal breaker.Read more 7 people found this helpful Helpful Comment Report abuse See all reviews from the United States
